fields.summary: CP.Android.Edit account flow pop up messages are missing headers

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :

1.Log into CP

2.Click on edit account on home page

3.Now edit and save or remove the account

4.Success pop up shows up

Expected result : Pop up should show headers like Error or Success.

Actual result : No headers are seen.

PFB screen for reference :

!image-2024-12-17-15-50-58-444.png!

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: disable app access for old cordova app

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: currently there is biller bwwp whose app is removed from play store and app store after AM request. But there are few users who already installed app they can still use old cordova mobile application and doing payments as well. we need to find out way so that users who already have installed app can stop doing their payment.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

worklogs.comment: tried uat payments in old cp mobile application and worked fine. Also tried to block payment method from AD and work as expected

APPLICATION_BLOCK=[application codes separated by comma]. This option allows for blocking applications per channel.
mobile-dashboard in PROD and UAT.
this configs was reference by AM and tried few cases after that and app access was blocked for payments.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: disable app access for CP billers based on configs

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
currently no configs are there by which we can disable app access for cp billers.
we will add one configs based on that app access can be disabled.

MOB_APP_BLOCK is new config added in CCO . if MOB_APP_BLOCK value is true then app will not allow to use and make payment . otherwise if MOB_APP_BLOCK is false which is default value then app will work normally. 

in future if any biller we want to disable to mobile use app access and users who already have app installed on their phone we have to restrict then simple we can add this config and make it true.

fields.summary: AI/ML: POC on Jira Issue Summarization

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
*Summary:*
Create a Proof of Concept (POC) for summarizing Jira issues using LangChain. This POC will generate:
 # A *day-wise summary* of an assignee's tasks.
 # An *epic-wise summary* of a sprint.
 # An *assignee summary* for a sprint.

The implementation should utilize {*}data filtering{*}, {*}prompting{*}, the {*}Summary Chain{*}, {*}LLM{*}, {*}structured output{*}, and the *streaming technique* in LangChain.

worklogs.comment:
1. Implemented functionality to generate Jira issue summaries in JSON format using an LLM.  
2. Researched and developed streaming capabilities for JSON-formatted output.  
3. Refactored the code to consolidate individual, epic, and day-wise summaries into a single method.  
4. Filtered Jira tickets and work done to update the KB page with work completed during the November timeline.

1. Worked on enhancing the readability of summaries generated by the LLM.  
2. Refactored the code to improve its clarity and readability.

1. Added Jira comments to the data to summarize Jira issues.  
2. Updated the prompt to generate a structured JSON output for individual summaries, epic-wise summaries, and category-wise summaries.
1. Worked on generating day-wise summary from llm.

1. Modified the prompt to fetch assignees in a day-wise summary.
2. Improved the day-wise summary to generate a summary for a specific day instead of the entire sprint at once.
3. Implemented the creation of a list (Assignee/Epic/Date) directly from the JIRA API response, bypassing the use of a dataframe.

1. Generated a day-wise summary for a specific day, including a list of assignees with activities on that particular date.  
2. Explored Router Chains in LangChain to route queries based on whether the user asked a 'question' or requested a 'summary.'

fields.summary: Dark Mode support

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
Description of requirement
Add support of dark mode in the compose design 

Current State
Designs are built in xml layouts so Xml libs are in use.

Expected State
Support Dark mode in compose.

Brief rationale for the change
Use Jetpack compose dark mode instead of XML since it is modern way to create screens and all new samples and components can only be rendered using jetpack compose.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Detail screen Design: Compose

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
Description of requirement
Implement Designs with new components of compose.

Current State
Designs are built in xml layouts so Xml libs are in use.

Expected State
Create screen in compose as future support is in compose only.

Brief rationale for the change
Use Jetpack compose instead of XML since it is modern way to create screens and all new samples and components can only be rendered using jetpack compose.
